availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Farran (Cincinnati, Ohio machinist and soldier)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio machinist and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Served in the 1st Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Sergeant from June 5, 1861 to. Served in the 1st Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 2nd Lieutenant from November 7, 1862 to . Taken prisoner of war at Coal River, Virginia on September 12, 1861 and held until November 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 3, p. 206.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 155.
Find A Grave, "James B. Farran (1836-1910)," Memorial #6511733, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6511733 (accessed August 5, 2020).
